criteria: Problem Definition Clarity: How well the student defines a simple design problem that can be solved using magnets.
Application of Scientific Ideas: How effectively the student applies scientific ideas about magnets to the proposed solution.
Design Solution Practicality: How practical and feasible the proposed design solution is.
Explanation of Magnetic Interactions: How well the student explains the magnetic forces and interactions relevant to their design.
descriptions: The student fails to identify or define a problem related to magnets.
The student attempts to define a problem, but it is unclear or not related to magnets.
The student defines a problem, but the connection to magnets is weak or not clearly articulated.
The student defines a problem that can be solved using magnets, with some clarity.
The student clearly defines a problem that can be solved using magnets, explaining the context and constraints.
The student defines a compelling and clearly articulated problem that can be solved effectively using magnets, demonstrating a thorough understanding of the problem's scope and relevant factors.
The student does not apply any scientific ideas about magnets in their proposed solution.
The student vaguely mentions scientific ideas about magnets, but does not apply them effectively.
The student attempts to apply scientific ideas, but the application is incorrect or superficial.
The student applies some relevant scientific ideas about magnets, but may have gaps in understanding or application.
The student effectively applies scientific ideas about magnets to develop a solution, demonstrating a good understanding of the underlying principles.
The student expertly applies scientific ideas about magnets to develop an innovative and well-reasoned solution, demonstrating a deep and nuanced understanding of the relevant scientific principles.
The proposed solution is completely impractical or infeasible.
The proposed solution has major practical limitations that are not addressed.
The proposed solution has some practical limitations, but attempts are made to address them.
The proposed solution is reasonably practical, with some consideration given to feasibility.
The proposed solution is practical and feasible, demonstrating a good understanding of real-world constraints.
The proposed solution is highly practical, feasible, and innovative, demonstrating exceptional attention to detail and a sophisticated understanding of real-world applications.
The student does not explain any magnetic forces or interactions.
The student's explanation of magnetic forces is minimal and unclear.
The student attempts to explain magnetic forces, but the explanation contains inaccuracies or omissions.
The student explains the relevant magnetic forces and interactions with reasonable accuracy.
The student clearly and accurately explains the magnetic forces and interactions involved in their design, demonstrating a solid understanding of the underlying physics.

The student provides a comprehensive and insightful explanation of the magnetic forces and interactions, demonstrating a sophisticated understanding of the underlying physics and their application to the design problem.
